snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin said visitors to Sochi for the Olympic Games, including gay men and lesbians, could be “relaxed and calm,” but he defended a ban on “homosexual propaganda.”
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin says that no one will be targeted at the Winter Olympics in Sochi under a federal law banning 'homosexual propaganda' among minors, even as he defends law as a way to protect children from exposure to nontraditional relationships.
lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin said visitors to Sochi for the Olympic Games, including gay men and lesbians, could be “relaxed and calm,” but he defended a ban on “homosexual propaganda.”

headline.main: Gays Can Be ‘Relaxed and Calm’ at the Olympics, Putin Says
headline.print_headline: Gays Can Be ‘Relaxed and Calm’ at the Olympics, Putin Says
